{{Use British English|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Will Hughes | image = Will Hughes.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Hughes in 2011 | fullname = William James Hughes<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/staticFiles/4e/bd/0,,10794~179534,00.pdf |title=Professional retain list & free transfers 2012/13 |publisher=The Football League |format=PDF |date=18 May 2013 |page=14 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140802074454/http://www.football-league.co.uk/staticFiles/4e/bd/0,,10794~179534,00.pdf |archivedate=2 August 2014 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|4|17|df=y}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/will-hughes-238666/ |title=Will Hughes |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Weybridge]], England | height = {{convert|1.85|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/will-hughes |title=Will Hughes |publisher=Watford F.C. |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 19 | youthyears1 = 2007–2011 | youthclubs1 = Mickleover Jubilee | youthyears2 = 2011 | youthclubs2 = [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] | years1 = 2011–2017 | clubs1 = [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] | caps1 = 165 | goals1 = 9 | years2 = 2017– | clubs2 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps2 = 37 | goals2 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2012–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 22 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | club-update = 08:48, 26 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''William James Hughes''' (born 17 April 1995) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
==Early years== Born in [[Weybridge]], Surrey,<ref>{{cite book|editor1-first=Glenda|editor1-last=Rollin|editor2-first=Jack|editor2-last=Rollin|title=Sky Sports Football Yearbook 2012–2013|year=2012|publisher=Headline Publishing Group|location=London|isbn=978-0-7553-6356-8|page=464|edition=43rd}}</ref> Hughes moved to [[Derby]] at the age of two.<ref name="hughesinsquad">{{cite web| title =Hughes to step up from the Rams Academy| url =http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/story-13763744-detail/story.html?| newspaper =Derby Telegraph| date =5 November 2011}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref name="bbcdec12interview"/> Hughes was first educated at St Peter's Junior school and then [[Repton School]] for secondary school in Derbyshire<ref name="bbcdec12interview"/> and played for the school football team, scoring the first goal in a 3–1 defeat to Brentwood in the Rensburg Sheppards ISFA Final.<ref name="hughesscores">{{cite web| title =Repton denied in decider| url =http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Repton-denied-decider/story-11648279-detail/story.html| archive-url =https://archive.is/20130505100514/http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Repton-denied-decider/story-11648279-detail/story.html| dead-url =yes| archive-date =5 May 2013| newspaper =Derby Telegraph| date =10 March 2010}}</ref> He then went on to play for local side Mickleover Jubilee, before he later signed for [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] as a first-year scholar in the summer of 2011.<ref name="hughesinsquad"/><ref name="bbcdec12interview"/>
==Club career== ===Derby County=== ====2011–12 season==== Hughes made his debut for the club's reserve team as a 70th minute [[substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 6–1 [[The Central League#Division One Central|Central League]] win over [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on 22 September 2011<ref name="walsallreserves">{{cite web| title =Derby County Res 6–1 Walsall Res| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2444297,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =22 September 2011}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> and made two additional appearances in the [[The Central League#Central League Cup|Central League Cup]]. It was his "outstanding"<ref name="portvalereserves">{{cite web| title =Derby County Res 1–0 Port Vale Res| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2500904,00.html?| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =1 November 2011}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> performance in a 1–0 win over [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] reserves in the competition on 1 November which brought him to manager [[Nigel Clough]]'s attention for possible inclusion in the Derby first-team squad against [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] four days later.<ref name="hughesinsquad"/>
Hughes made his full debut for Derby as a 90th-minute substitute for [[Jamie Ward]]. Despite entering the match late with the scores level, there was still time for Hughes' first-team debut to end in defeat as a 94th-minute goal saw Peterborough win 3–2.<ref name="peterborodefeat">{{cite web| title =Peterborough United 3 – 2 Derby County| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10270~58235,00.html| archive-url =http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20110116024428/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10270%7E58235%2C00.html| dead-url =yes| archive-date =16 January 2011| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =5 November 2011}}</ref>
After Derby midfielder [[Paul Green (footballer, born 1983)|Paul Green]], who was out-of-contract at the end of the season, rejected a contract offer, Clough dropped him and promoted Hughes to the first-team squad as his replacement for the penultimate match of the season at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]].<ref name="pompey">{{cite news| url =http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Clough-cast-net-Green-turns-offer/story-15866524-detail/story.html| title =Clough to cast net after Green turns down offer| newspaper =Derby Telegraph| date =20 April 2012| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20120422082108/http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Clough-cast-net-Green-turns-offer/story-15866524-detail/story.html| archivedate =22 April 2012| df =dmy-all}}</ref> Hughes started the match on the substitute's bench and came on in the 68th minute, replacing [[Theo Robinson]] in a 2–1 win.<ref name="pompeygame">{{cite web| title =Portsmouth 1–2 Derby County| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10270~59014,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =21 April 2012}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Hughes started his first match for the senior team in the final match of the season, a 1–1 draw against Peterborough United.<ref name="firststart">{{cite web| title =Derby County 1–1 Peterborough United| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10270~59299,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =28 April 2012}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Hughes' performance match earned praise from Derby manager Nigel Clough.<ref name="cloughpraise">{{cite web| title =Clough Impressed By Hughes Display| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2754789,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =30 April 2012| access-date =1 May 2012| archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20120502201320/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2754789,00.html#| archive-date =2 May 2012| dead-url =yes| df =dmy-all}}</ref> At Derby's awards night, Hughes won the Scholar of the Year Award.<ref name="2012awards">{{cite web| title =Bryson Named Club Player of the Year| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2754942,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =2 May 2012}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== After impressing in pre-season, Clough said that Hughes could be in line for a place in the starting line-up in the first match of [[2012–13 Derby County F.C. season|the season]] against [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]] in the [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref name="frame">{{cite web| title ='Will Hughes is in frame for Derby County starting line-up'| url =http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Hughes-frame-Derby-County-starting-line/story-16669813-detail/story.html| newspaper =Derby Telegraph| date =8 August 2012| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20120813102631/http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Hughes-frame-Derby-County-starting-line/story-16669813-detail/story.html| archivedate =13 August 2012| df =dmy-all}}</ref> Clough was particularly impressed with his substitute appearance against [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] saying, "When he came off the bench at Colchester, he was very good indeed. I thought he was the star of the subs. He looked comfortable. I don't think he gave the ball away and he made our equaliser. We are very pleased with him."<ref name="frame"/>
Hughes scored his first goal for the club in a 5–1 win against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 1 September 2012.<ref name="goal1">{{cite web| title =Derby 5–1 Watford| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19378170| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 1 September 2012 }}</ref> Hughes signed a new contract in October 2012, committing his future at the club until summer 2015.<ref name="deal">{{cite web| title =Hughes Pens New Rams Deal| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/hughes-commits-to-the-rams-434969.aspx| publisher = Derby County F.C. | date = 20 October 2012 }}</ref> Hughes scored his second goal for the club in a 2–1 defeat at [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] on 10 November, scoring an equalising goal from 20 yards.<ref name="goal2">{{cite web| title =Millwall 1–2 Derby| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20189961| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 10 November 2012 }}</ref> In November 2012, Hughes was linked with moves to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and Manchester City.<ref name="nov12links">{{cite news | title =Derby County teenager Will Hughes attracts Premier League interest ahead of possible England debut| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/9673363/Derby-County-teenager-Will-Hughes-attracts-Premier-League-interest-ahead-of-possible-England-debut.html| newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London | date = 12 November 2012 }}</ref> Nigel Clough denied the rumours,<ref name="nov12denial">{{cite web| title =No bids for promising Ram| url =http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/no-bids-promising-ram-185755004.html| publisher =Yahoo! Eurosport| date =14 November 2012| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20140106032138/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/no-bids-promising-ram-185755004.html| archivedate =6 January 2014| df =dmy-all}}</ref> however he said the interest in the player was inevitable and said many scouts had been at Derby matches to watch Hughes.<ref name="inevitable">{{cite web| title =Will Hughes: Derby manager says interest inevitable| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20330068| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 14 November 2012 }}</ref> Spanish club [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] were also reported to have had an interest in Hughes, after scouts from the Catalan club "compiled a detailed dossier" on Hughes when he appeared for [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] in the Algarve Tournament in February 2012.{{citation needed|date=August 2018}}
Hughes was named the [[Football League Young Player of the Month]] for November 2012, after a series of impressive performances.<ref name="FLYPotM">{{cite web | title = Hughes named Young Player of the Month | url = http://www.football-league.co.uk/championship/news/20121221/hughes-named-young-player-of-the-month_2293322_3015087 | publisher = The Football League | date = 21 December 2012 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130319215632/http://www.football-league.co.uk/championship/news/20121221/hughes-named-young-player-of-the-month_2293322_3015087 | archivedate = 19 March 2013 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> On the eve of the 2013 January transfer window, it was reported in the ''[[Derby Telegraph]]'' that Hughes was being closely observed by 10 [[Premier League]] clubs with [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]'s manager [[Martin Jol]] saying of Hughes, "Believe me, there are probably 10 clubs in the Premier League having a look at him. He is one of these wonderful talents, so he is always on lists. If you have a good scouting system, he will always be on the list but we will see."<ref name="martinjolcomments10">{{cite web| title =Fulham boss Martin Jol one of 10 with eyes on Will Hughes| url =http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Fulham-boss-Martin-Jol-10-eyes-Hughes/story-17691095-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph | date = 27 December 2012 }}</ref>
In February 2013, during a 0–0 draw against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], Hughes picked up a groin injury and was replaced after 63 minutes. As a result of this injury, Hughes ended his ever-present run of Derby first-team appearances after 35 matches and ended a run of 37 consecutive appearances.<ref name="march13inj">{{cite web| title =Midfielder Will Hughes ruled out of Derby County's tough double header| url =http://www.thisisderbyshire.co.uk/Midfielder-Hughes-ruled-Derby-County-s-tough/story-18265227-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph | date = 27 February 2013 }}</ref> With twelve matches remaining in the season and with Derby unlikely to fight for a play-off place and with Hughes being ruled out for the first two matches in March;<ref name="march13inj"/> Clough said he considered resting Hughes for the rest of season to reduce stress on his body.{{citation needed|date=August 2018}}
In April 2013, Hughes signed a one-year extension to his contract after his 18th birthday, extending his stay until June 2016.<ref name="deal1year">{{cite web| title =Hughes Extends Derby Contract| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/hughes-extends-derby-contract-778500.aspx| publisher = Derby County F.C. | date = 18 April 2013 }}</ref> Hughes returned to first-team action before schedule on 20 April as an 85th-minute substitute in Derby's 3–1 against Peterborough United.<ref name="return">{{cite web| title =Derby 3–1 Peterborough| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22133302| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 20 April 2013 }}</ref> At the end of the season, Hughes won the [[Sammy Crooks]] Young Player of the Year award.<ref name="ypoy13">{{cite web | title=Keogh Named Club Player of the Year| publisher=Derby County F.C. | url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/keogh-named-club-player-of-the-year-803602.aspx| date = 2 May 2013 }}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== Ahead of the [[2013–14 Derby County F.C. season|2013–14 season]], Hughes was expected to compete with [[Craig Bryson]], [[Paul Coutts]] and [[Jeff Hendrick]], with then-manager Nigel Clough stating that rotation could be utilised.<ref name="1314plans">{{cite news| url =http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Nigel-Clough-pondering-midfield-dilemma-Derby/story-19552961-detail/story.html| title =Nigel Clough still pondering midfield dilemma for Derby County| date =23 July 2013|newspaper=Derby Telegraph| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20130726153408/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Nigel-Clough-pondering-midfield-dilemma-Derby/story-19552961-detail/story.html| archivedate =26 July 2013| df =dmy-all}}</ref> Hughes scored his first goal of the season on 27 August in a 5–0 win against League One side [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] in the League Cup.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23764109 "Derby 5–0 Brentford"]. BBC Sport. 27 August 2013. Retrieved 8 October 2013.</ref> He scored his first league goal of the season in a 3–1 defeat at home to [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 21 September.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24089713 "Derby 1–3 Reading"]. BBC Sport. 21 September 2013. Retrieved 8 October 2013.</ref> This was Hughes' last goal under Nigel Clough, who was sacked a week later following a 1–0 defeat at the hands of rivals [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] in the [[Derby County F.C.–Nottingham Forest F.C. rivalry|East Midlands derby]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24320051 "Nigel Clough: Derby County sack manager after defeat at Forest"]. BBC Sport. 28 September 2013. Retrieved 8 October 2013.</ref><ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24185008 "Nott'm Forest 1–0 Derby"]. BBC Sport. 28 September 2013. Retrieved 8 October 2013.</ref> Clough was replaced by former [[England national football team|England]] manager [[Steve McClaren]],<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24331558"Steve McClaren named as Derby County head coach"Steve McClaren named as Derby County head coach"]. BBC Sport. 30 September 2013. Retrieved 8 October 2013.</ref> and Hughes scored in his first match in charge of Derby; a 3–1 win against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24349291 "Derby County 3–1 Leeds"]. BBC Sport. 5 October 2013. Retrieved 8 October 2013.</ref>
====2014–15 season==== On 1 July 2014, Hughes agreed a new four-year contract at Derby County, which would see his contract at the club extended until the end of the [[2017–18 Derby County F.C. season|2017–18 season]].<ref name="Will Hughes Signs A New Long-Term Contract At Derby County">{{cite web|title=Will Hughes Signs A New Long-Term Contract At Derby County|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/will-hughes-signs-a-new-long-term-contract-at-derby-county-1709157.aspx|publisher=Derby County F.C.|accessdate=1 July 2014}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== On 8 August 2015 in the season opener against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton]], Hughes damaged his anterior cruciate ligaments in his right knee and was ruled out for six months.<ref>{{cite news|title = Derby midfielder out for six months with knee injury|url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33860485 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=31 August 2015}}</ref> In April 2016, he rejoined the first-team squad at Derby after returning to full fitness.<ref>[http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-Rams-ace-Hughes-contention-team/story-29069389-detail/story.html] {{dead link|date=April 2016}}</ref>
===Watford=== On 24 June 2017, Hughes joined Premier League club Watford on a five-year contract for an undisclosed fee, reported to be around £8 million.<ref>{{cite web |title = Official: Hughes Is A Hornet |url = https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/official-hughes-hornet |publisher=Watford F.C. |date=24 June 2017 |accessdate=24 June 2017}}</ref> Hughes became newly appointed manager [[Marco Silva]]'s first signing of the season.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rouse|first1=Daniel|title=Marco Silva makes Will Hughes his 1st Watford buy for reported £8M|url=https://www.thescore.com/epl/news/1324042-marco-silva-makes-will-hughes-his-1st-watford-buy-for-reported-8m|accessdate=4 July 2017|publisher=The Score|date=24 June 2017}}</ref>
==International career== On 17 January 2012, Hughes was called up to the England U17 for the first time for the Algarve Tournament in February 2012, he was joined by his teammate [[Mason Bennett]].<ref name="englandu17callup">{{cite web| title =Bennett & Hughes Get England Call-Ups| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2579822,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =17 January 2012| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20120125164720/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2579822,00.html| archivedate =25 January 2012| df =dmy-all}}</ref> Hughes appeared in all three match, as England won the three-match tournament with seven points.<ref name="algravetournamentwin">{{cite web| title =Bennett & Hughes Start in England U17 Win| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2601735,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =18 January 2012| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20120209023731/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2601735,00.html| archivedate =9 February 2012| df =dmy-all}}</ref> Hughes scored a goal in the 2–2 draw against [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands U17]] on 4 February 2012. Hughes was also called up the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship elite round]] in March 2012, however England failed to qualify for the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|main tournament]], finishing third in their group on four points, with their exit confirmed in a 4–0 loss to [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]].<ref name="4-0spainloss">{{cite web| title =Hughes & Bennett Feature in England Defeat| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2601735,00.html| publisher =Derby County F.C.| date =13 April 2012| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20120209023731/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2601735,00.html| archivedate =9 February 2012| df =dmy-all}}</ref> In August 2012, Hughes was named as standby for the [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] squad for a friendly against [[Germany national youth football team|Germany U19]] in September.<ref name="u19standby">{{cite web| title =Hughes on England Standby| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/hughes-on-england-standby-333641.aspx| publisher =Derby County F.C. | date = 25 August 2012 }}</ref> On 19 November 2013, Hughes scored his first goal for England U21 against [[San Marino national under-21 football team|San Marino U21]].{{citation needed|date=November 2017}}
In November 2012, Hughes made his first appearance for the [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] squad in a friendly against [[Northern Ireland national under-21 football team|Northern Ireland U21]] on 13 November.<ref name="u21sqaud">{{cite web| title =England U-21 ring changes for Northern Ireland friendly| url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20255047| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 8 November 2012 }}</ref> Hughes came on as a 65th-minute substitute for [[Josh McEachran]], becoming the second youngest player to get capped for the U21s,<ref name="u21debut">{{cite web| title =Hughes Gains England Under 21 Honours| url =http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/hughes-gains-england-under-21-honours-485320.aspx| publisher =Derby County F.C. | date = 13 November 2012 }}</ref> beaten only by [[Theo Walcott]].<ref name="bbcdec12interview"/> Derby youth academy director [[Darren Wassall]] praised Hughes after his call-up to the England U21 side, saying "It's a great achievement to get in at 17 and we are all delighted for him. To make that rise into the Under-21s so soon is fantastic for him and everyone at the club."<ref name="praisewassall">{{cite web| title =Derby's Will Hughes can "come alive" for England Under-21s| url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20272033| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 13 November 2012 }}</ref> Hughes called the experience "surreal".<ref name="hughesu21surreal">{{cite web| title =Will Hughes: England call surreal says Derby teenager| url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20340777| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 15 November 2012 }}</ref>
==Style of play== Hughes has been described as a "flair player" who uses through balls and mazy runs to create space for teammates and beat opposition defences in attacking positions.<ref name="bbcdec12interview">{{cite web| title =Derby's Will Hughes – the Championship's latest sensation| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20769208| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 21 December 2012 }}</ref>
Hughes said in a December 2012 interview for the BBC, that he bases his play on Barcelona and [[Spain national football team|Spanish international]] central midfielders [[Xavi]] and [[Andrés Iniesta]].<ref name="bbcdec12interview"/> Hughes states his strengths are his passing and technical ability and targeted improvements in pace and physical strength.<ref name="bbcdec12interview"/>
Hughes' former England U21 coach [[Stuart Pearce]] described Hughes as "technically a very sound player". "He rarely gave the ball away in training or in the game he played [against Northern Ireland], which is vitally important at international level. He's progressing really well."<ref name="bbcdec12interview"/>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 22 February 2019}}

Cup|League Cup]] !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=7|[[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] |[[2011–12 Derby Derby County F.C. season|2012–13]]<ref name=sb1213>{{soccerbase season|62917|2012|accessdate=25 November 2017}}</ref> |Championship |35||2||2||0||1||0||colspan=2|—||38||2 |- |[[2013–14 Derby County F.C. season|2013–14]]<ref name=sb1314>{{soccerbase season|62917|2013|accessdate=25 November 2017}}</ref> |Championship |41||3||1||0||3||1||3{{efn|name=CPO|Appearances in [[EFL Championship play-offs|Championship play-offs]]}}||1||48||5 |- |[[2014–15 Derby County F.C. season|2014–15]]<ref name=sb1415>{{soccerbase season|62917|2014|accessdate=25 November 2017}}</ref> |Championship |42||2||1||1||5||0||colspan=2|—||48||3 |- |[[2015–16 Derby County F.C. season|2015–16]]<ref name=sb1516>{{soccerbase season|62917|2015|name=Will Hughes|accessdate=25 November 2017}}</ref>
